column12: Title
SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR RESTORING COGNITIVE FUNCTION
column13: Systems and methods for restoring cognitive function are disclosed. In some implementations, a method includes, at a computing device, separately stimulating one or more of lateral and medial entorhinal afferents and other structures connecting to a hippocampus of an animal subject in accordance with a plurality of predefined stimulation patterns, thereby attempting to restore object-specific memories and location-specific memories; collecting a plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings of the stimulation of hippocampalentorhinal cortical (HEC) system; and refining the computational model for restoring individual memories in accordance with a portion of the plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings.
column32: NANTHIA, S. ET AL.: "Memory Enhancement and Deep-Brain Stimulation of the Entorhinal Area", THE NEW ENGLAND JOURNAL OF MEDICINE, vol. 366, 9 February 2012 (2012-02-09), pages 502 - 510, XP055243435;;See also references of EP 3151908A4

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR RESTORING COGNITIVE FUNCTION
SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
column13: The various embodiments described herein include methods, devices, and systems for enhancement of memory. In one aspect, a method includes: (1) implanting intracranial electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed selectively at a specific brain site; (2) determining a threshold for eliciting an after-discharge threshold of the patient, and (3) stimulating the electrodes with current set below the after-discharge threshold while the patient is in a particular phase of sleep so as to enhance memory of the patient.
column32: "Single pulse electrical stimulation of the himmpocampus is sufficient o impair human episodic memory" Lacruz et al., Neuroscince 170(2):623-32;;"Recall deficits produced by after discharges in the human hippocampal formation and amygdala" Halgren, Electroencephphalogr Clin Neurophysiol 61: 375-380:;;"Human Medial Temporal-Lob Stimulation Disrupts both formation and retrieval of recent memories" Halgren et al, Brain Cogn 4 287-295

column12: SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
column13: A site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory is described. A method of the site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory may include implanting intracranial depth electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed in right and/or left entorhinal regions, and stimulating the electrodes with current set below an after-discharge threshold. The method may include stimulation at a specific brain site in the medial temporal lobe, stimulation (ODTS) at specific stages of information processing. A system for site specific deep brain stimulation of entorhinal regions during specific stages of information processing is also described.

column12: SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
Site specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory
column13: The various embodiments described herein include methods, devices, and systems for enhancement of memory. In one aspect, a method includes: (1) implanting intracranial electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed selectively at a specific brain site; (2) determining a threshold for eliciting an after-discharge threshold of the patient, and (3) stimulating the electrodes with current set below the after-discharge threshold while the patient is in a particular phase of sleep so as to enhance memory of the patient.

In some implementations, a method includes, at a computing device, separately stimulating one or more of lateral and medial entorhinal afferents and other structures connecting to a hippocampus of an animal subject in accordance with a plurality of predefined stimulation patterns, thereby attempting to restore object-specific memories and location-specific memories; collecting a plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings of the stimulation of hippocampalentorhinal cortical (HEC) system; and refining the computational model for restoring individual memories in accordance with a portion of the plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings.

column12: SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
column13: A site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory is described. A method of the site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory may include implanting intracranial depth electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed in right and/or left entorhinal regions, and stimulating the electrodes with current set below an after-discharge threshold. The method may include stimulation at a specific brain site in the medial temporal lobe, stimulation (ODTS) at specific stages of information processing. A system for site specific deep brain stimulation of entorhinal regions during specific stages of information processing is also described.

column12: Specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory
column13: A site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory is described. A method of the site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory may include implanting intracranial depth electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed in right and/or left entorhinal regions, and stimulating the electrodes with current set below an after-discharge threshold. The method may include stimulation at a specific brain site in the medial temporal lobe, stimulation (ODTS) at specific stages of information processing. A system for site specific deep brain stimulation of entorhinal regions during specific stages of information processing is also described.

column12: Systems and methods for restoring cognitive function
column13: Systems and methods for restoring cognitive function are disclosed. In some implementations, a method includes, at a computing device, separately stimulating one or more of lateral and medial entorhinal afferents and other structures connecting to a hippocampus of an animal subject in accordance with a plurality of predefined stimulation patterns, thereby attempting to restore object-specific memories and location-specific memories; collecting a plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings of the stimulation of hippocampalentorhinal cortical (HEC) system; and refining the computational model for restoring individual memories in accordance with a portion of the plurality of one or more of macro- and micro-recordings.
column32: Nanthia, S. et al., “Memory Enhancement and Deep-Brain Stimulation of the Entorhinal Area,” The New England Journal of Medicine, vol. 366, pp. 502-510, Feb. 9, 2012.;;The Regents of the University of California, International Search Report and Written Opinion, PCT/US2015/034962, dated Sep. 17, 2015, 9 Pgs.;;The Regents of the University of California, International Preliminary Report on Patentability, PCT/US2015/034962, dated Dec. 15, 2016, 6 pgs.;;The Regentes of the University of California, Communication Pursuant to Rules 161(2) and 162, EP15806123.4, dated Feb. 15, 2017, 2 pgs.;;Berger et al., “Restoring lost cognitive function,” IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Magazine, IEEE Service Center, vol. 24, No. 6, Sep. 1, 2005, 15 pgs.;;The Regentes of the University of California, Extended European Search Report, EP15806123.4, Mar. 9, 2018, 6 pgs.;;The Regentes of the University of California, Communication Pursuant to Rules 70(2) and 70a(2), EP15806123.4, Mar. 27, 2018, 1 pg.

column12: SITE SPECIFIC DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION FOR ENHANCEMENT OF MEMORY
column13: A site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory is described. A method of the site-specific deep brain stimulation for enhancement of memory may include implanting intracranial depth electrodes in a patient, wherein the electrodes are placed in right and/or left entorhinal regions, and stimulating the electrodes with current set below an after-discharge threshold. The method may include stimulation at a specific brain site in the medial temporal lobe, stimulation (ODTS) at specific stages of information processing. A system for site specific deep brain stimulation of entorhinal regions during specific stages of information processing is also described.

column16: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA (2013-06-01)

column12: MEMORY ENHANCEMENT BY PREFRONTAL DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION SYNCHRONIZED TO MEDIAL TEMPORAL LOBE DURING SLEEP
column13: A closed-loop neuromodulatory system comprises one or more processors and memory. The system is configured to record signals from a first region of a brain of a human subject during sleep via a first electrode. The system is configured to determine, from the recorded signals, active periods of the first region. The system is configured to stimulate a second region of the brain, different from the first region, during the active periods via a second electrode that is electrically coupled to the first electrode via closed-loop control.
column14: UNIV CALIFORNIA;;FRIED ITZHAK;;NIR YUVAL;;GEVA SAGIV MAYA

column12: MINIMALLY INVASIVE IMPLANTABLE BRAIN STIMULATION DEVICES AND METHODS FOR IMPLANTING SAME
column13: A brain stimulation device includes: a threaded head portion; a needle portion connected to the threaded head portion; at least one wireless power source arranged in proximity to the threaded head portion, the at least one wireless power source being configured to generate electrical energy for the brain stimulation device responsive to a wireless power signal being received by the brain stimulation device; and at least one electrode arranged at least partially on an outside surface of the needle portion in electrical communication with the at least one wireless power source, wherein the at least one electrode is configured to transmit an electrical signal responsive to receiving the electrical energy from the at least one wireless power source. A method of using the brain stimulation device is also described.
